022import static java.util.Arrays.deepToString;

024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NULL_STRING;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.SharedFormatter.format;

030import java.util.Collections;

053/**
054 *  <p>{@summary This class consists of several utility methods working on
055 *  {@link Object}
056 *  instances, similar to those on
057 *  {@link Arrays}
058 *  or
059 *  {@link Collections}.}</p>
060 *  <p>The class was originally inspired by the class of the same name that
061 *  was finally introduced with the Java&nbsp;7 release; some of its methods
062 *  will delegate to
063 *  {@link java.util.Objects java.util.Objects},
064 *  others will extend the functionality of the methods with the same
065 *  name from {@code java.util.Objects}.</p>
066 *  <p>If a method from {@code java.util.Objects} would throw a
067 *  {@link NullPointerException},
068 *  the method with the same name from this class would throw a
069 *  {@link ValidationException}
070 *  instead.</p>
071 *
072 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
073 *  @version $Id: Objects.java 1048 2023-02-18 00:22:43Z tquadrat $
074 *  @since 0.1.0
075 *
076 *  @UMLGraph.link
077 */
078@UtilityClass
079@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "UseOfObsoleteDateTimeApi", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
080@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Objects.java 1048 2023-02-18 00:22:43Z tquadrat $" )
081public final class Objects
082{
083        /*--------------*\
084    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
085        \*--------------*/
086    /**
087     *  No instance allowed for this class.
088     */
089    private Objects() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Objects.class ); }
090
091        /*---------*\
092    ====** Methods **==========================================================
093        \*---------*/
094    /**
095     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
096     *  to {@code fromIndex + size} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range
097     *  from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
098     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
099     *  inequalities is true:</p>
100     *  <ul>
101     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
102     *    <li>{@code size < 0}</li>
103     *    <li>{@code fromIndex + size > length}, taking into account integer
104     *    overflow</li>
105     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
106     *    inequalities</li>
107     *  </ul>
108     *  <p>Calls
109     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int)}
110     *  internally.</p>
111     *
112     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-interval.
113     *  @param  size    The size of the sub-range.
114     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
115     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
116     *      range.
117     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
118     */
119    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
120    public static final int checkFromIndexSize( final int fromIndex, final int size, final int length )
121    {
122        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize( fromIndex, size, length );
123
124        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
125        return retValue;
126    }   //  checkFromIndexSize()
127
128    /**
129     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
130     *  to {@code toIndex} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range from
131     *  {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
132     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
133     *  inequalities is true:</p>
134     *  <ul>
135     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
136     *    <li>{@code fromIndex > toIndex}</li>
137     *    <li>{@code toIndex > length}</li>
138     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
139     *    inequalities</li>
140     *  </ul>
141     *  <p>Calls
142     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromToIndex(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex(int,int,int)}
143     *  internally.</p>
144     *
145     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-range.
146     *  @param  toIndex The upper-bound (exclusive) of the sub-range.
147     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) the range.
148     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
149     *      range.
150     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
151     */
152    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
153    public static final int checkFromToIndex( final int fromIndex, final int toIndex, final int length )
154    {
155        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex( fromIndex, toIndex, length );
156
157        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
158        return retValue;
159    }   //  checkFromToIndex()
160
161    /**
162     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the {@code index} is within the bounds of the
163     *  range from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
164     *  <p>The {@code index} is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the
165     *  following inequalities is true:</p>
166     *  <ul>
167     *    <li>{@code index < 0}</li>
168     *    <li>{@code index >= length}</li>
169     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
170     *    inequalities</li>
171     *  </ul>
172     *  <p>Calls
173     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkIndex(int,int) java.util.Objects.checkIndex(int,int)}
174     *  internally.</p>
175     *
176     *  @param  index   The index.
177     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
178     *  @return The {@code index} if it is within bounds of the range.
179     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The {@code index} is out-of-bounds.
180     */
181    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
182    public static final int checkIndex( final int index, final int length )
183    {
184        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkIndex( index, length );
185
186        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
187        return retValue;
188    }   //  checkIndex()
189
190    /**
191     *  <p>{@summary Throws the exception provided by the given supplier if the
192     *  condition resolves to {@code false}.}</p>
193     *  <p>Basically, this method is a replacement for the code sequence
194     *  below:</p>
195     *  <pre><code>  …
196     *  if( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt; )
197     *  {
198     *      throw new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; );
199     *  }
200     *  …</code></pre>
201     *  <p>that may be easier to read than the {@code if} statement:</p>
202     *  <pre><code>  …
203     *  checkState( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt;, () -> new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; ) );
204     *  …</code></pre>
205     *
206     *  @param  <E> The type of the exception that is thrown in case the
207     *      condition is not met.
208     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
209     *  @param  exception   The exception to throw.
210     *  @throws E   The condition was not met.
211     */
212    @SuppressWarnings( "CheckedExceptionClass" )
213    public static final <E extends Exception> void checkState( final boolean condition, final Supplier<E> exception ) throws E
214    {
215        if( !condition ) throw requireNonNullArgument( exception, "exception" ).get();
216    }   //  checkState()
217
218    /**
219     *  <p>{@summary Returns 0 if the arguments are identical and
220     *  {@code comparator.compare(a, b)} otherwise.}</p>
221     *  <p>Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, 0 is returned.</p>
222     *  <p>Calls
223     *  {@link java.util.Objects#compare(Object,Object,Comparator) java.util.Objects#compare()}
224     *  internally, but different from that method, this implementation will
225     *  throw a
226     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
227     *  in case the {@code comparator} is {@code null}.</p>
228     *
229     *  @param  <T> The type of the objects being compared.
230     *  @param  a   An object.
231     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a}.
232     *  @param  comparator  The
233     *      {@link Comparator}
234     *      to compare the first two arguments.
235     *  @return 0 if the arguments are identical and +1, 0, or -1, based on the
236     *      return value of {@code c.compare(a, b)} otherwise.
237     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code comparator} is {@code null}.
238     *
239     *  @see Comparable
240     *  @see Comparator
241     */
242    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
243    public static final <T> int compare( final T a, final T b, final Comparator<? super T> comparator ) throws NullArgumentException
244    {
245        final var retValue = a == b ? 0 : signum( java.util.Objects.compare( a, b, requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" ) ) );
246
247        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
248        return retValue;
249    }   //  compare()
250
251    /**
252     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to
253     *  each other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
254     *  <p>Two {@code null} values are deeply equal. If both arguments are
255     *  arrays, the algorithm in
256     *  {@link Arrays#deepEquals(Object[], Object[]) Arrays.deepEquals()}
257     *  is used to determine equality. Otherwise, equality is determined by
258     *  using the
259     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
260     *  method of the first argument.</p>
261     *  <p>Calls
262     *  {@link java.util.Objects#deepEquals(Object,Object) java.util.Objects#deepEquals()}
263     *  internally.</p>
264     *
265     *  @param  a   An object.
266     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for deep equality.
267     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to each other
268     *      and {@code false} otherwise.
269     *
270     *  @see    Arrays#deepEquals(Object[],Object[])
271     *  @see    Objects#equals(Object,Object)
272     */
273    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
274    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
275    public static final boolean deepEquals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.deepEquals( a, b ); }
276
277    /**
278     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each
279     *  other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
280     *  <p> Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, {@code true} is
281     *  returned and if exactly one argument is {@code null}, {@code false} is
282     *  returned.  Otherwise, equality is determined by using the
283     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
284     *  method of the first argument.</p>
285     *  <p>Calls
286     *  {@link java.util.Objects#equals(Object, Object)}
287     *  internally.</p>
288     *
289     *  @param  a   An object.
290     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for equality.
291     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each other and
292     *      {@code false} otherwise.
293     *
294     *  @see    Object#equals(Object)
295     */
296    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
297    public static final boolean equals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.equals( a, b ); }
298
299    /**
300     *  <p>{@summary Generates a hash code for a sequence of input values.} The
301     *  hash code is generated as if all the input values were placed into an
302     *  array, and that array is hashed by calling
303     *  {@link Arrays#hashCode(Object[])}.</p>
304     *  <p>Calls
305     *  {@link java.util.Arrays#hashCode(Object[]) java.util.Arrays.hashCode()}
306     *  internally.</p>
307     *
308     *  @param  values  The values to be hashed.
309     *  @return A hash value of the sequence of input values.
310     *
311     *  @see    List#hashCode
312     */
313    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
314    public static final int hash( final Object... values ) { return Arrays.hashCode( values ); }
315
316    /**
317     *  <p>{@summary Returns the hash code of a non-{@code null} argument and 0
318     *  for a {@code null} argument.}</p>
319     *  <p>Calls
320     *  {@link java.util.Objects#hashCode(Object) java.util.Objects.hashCode(Object)}
321     *  internally.</p>
322     *
323     *  @param o   An object.
324     *  @return The hash code of an argument that is not {@code null}, and 0
325     *      for a {@code null} argument,
326     *
327     *  @see    Object#hashCode
328     */
329    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
330    public static final int hashCode( final Object o ) { return java.util.Objects.hashCode( o ); }
331
332    /**
333     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is
334     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
335     *  <p>This method can be used as a
336     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
337     *  {@code filter(Objects::isNull)}.</p>
338     *  <p>Calls
339     *  {@link java.util.Objects#isNull(Object) java.util.Objects.isNull()}
340     *  internally.</p>
341     *
342     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}.
343     *  @return {@code true} if the provided reference is {@code null},
344     *      otherwise {@code false}
345     *
346     *  @see    java.util.function.Predicate
347     *  @see    org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#IS_NULL
348     */
349    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
350    public static final boolean isNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.isNull( obj ); }
351
352    /**
353     *  <p>{@summary Provides a replacement value if the given value is
354     *  {@code null}.}</p>
355     *
356     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
357     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
358     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the replacement function.
359     *  @return The provided object if that is not {@code null}, or the result
360     *      from the supplier method. Keep in mind that this result can be
361     *      {@code null}!
362     */
363    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.2" )
364    public static final <T> T mapFromNull( final T o, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier )
365    {
366        final var retValue = isNull( o )
367            ? requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ).get()
368            : o;
369
370        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
371        return retValue;
372    }   //  mapFromNull()
373
374    /**
375     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the
376     *  provided mapper if the instance is not {@code null}.}</p>
377     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance
378     *  is {@code null}.</p>
379     *
380     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
381     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
382     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
383     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
384     *  @return The result of the mapping, or {@code null} if the given object
385     *      instance was already {@code null}. Keep in mind that the result of
386     *      the mapping can be {@code null}!
387     */
388    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,? extends R> mapper )
389    {
390        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
391        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : null;
392
393        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
394        return retValue;
395    }   //  mapNonNull()
396
397    /**
398     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the
399     *  provided mapper if the instance is not {@code null} or returns the
400     *  given default value.}</p>
401     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance
402     *  is {@code null}.</p>
403     *
404     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
405     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
406     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
407     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
408     *  @param  defaultValue    The default value; can be {@code null}.
409     *  @return The result of the mapping, or the default value if the given
410     *      object instance is {@code null}. Keep in mind that the result of
411     *      the mapping can be {@code null}!
412     */
413    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,? extends R> mapper, final R defaultValue )
414    {
415        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
416        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : defaultValue;
417
418        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
419        return retValue;
420    }   //  mapNonNull()
421
422    /**
423     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is not
424     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
425     *  <p>This method exists to be used as a
426     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
427     *  {@code filter(Objects::nonNull)}</p>
428     *  <p>Calls
429     *  {@link java.util.Objects#nonNull(Object) java.util.Objects.nonNull()}
430     *  internally.</p>
431     *
432     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}
433     *  @return {@code false} if the provided reference is {@code null},
434     *      otherwise {@code true}
435     *
436     *  @see java.util.function.Predicate
437     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NON_NULL
438     */
439    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
440    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
441    public static final boolean nonNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.nonNull( obj ); }
442
443    /**
444     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
445     *  {@link ValidationException}
446     *  is thrown.
447     *
448     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
449     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
450     *  @param  validation  The validation
451     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
452     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
453     *
454     *  @since 0.1.0
455     */
456    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
457    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
458    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
459    {
460        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
461        {
462            throw new ValidationException();
463        }
464
465        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
466        return obj;
467    }   //  require()
468
469    /**
470     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
471     *  {@link ValidationException}
472     *  with the specified message is thrown.
473     *
474     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
475     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
476     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
477     *  @param  validation  The validation
478     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
479     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
480     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
481     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
482     *
483     *  @since 0.1.0
484     */
485    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
486    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final String message, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
487    {
488        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
489
490        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
491        {
492            throw new ValidationException( message );
493        }
494
495        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
496        return obj;
497    }   //  require()
498
499    /**
500     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
501     *  that fails, a customized
502     *  {@link ValidationException}
503     *  is thrown.}</p>
504     *  <p>Unlike the method
505     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
506     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
507     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
508     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care should be taken
509     *  that the costs for the creation of the message supplier are less than
510     *  the cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
511     *
512     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
513     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
514     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
515     *      in the event that {@code ValidationException} is thrown. If
516     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
517     *      provided to the exception.
518     *  @param  validation  The validation
519     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
520     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The validation is {@code null}.
521     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obk} failed the validation.
522     *
523     *  @since 0.1.0
524     */
525    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
526    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
527    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
528    {
529        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
530        {
531            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
532                ? new ValidationException( messageSupplier.get() )
533                : new ValidationException();
534            throw exception;
535        }
536
537        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
538        return obj;
539    }   //  require()
540
541    /**
542     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
543     *  that fails, a customized
544     *  {@link ValidationException}
545     *  is thrown.}</p>
546     *  <p>Unlike the method
547     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
548     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
549     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
550     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care  should be taken
551     *  that the costs the creation of the message supplier are less than the
552     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
553     *  <p>This implementation is different from
554     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object, Supplier)}
555     *  as it takes an instance of
556     *  {@link Function}
557     *  for the {@code messageSupplier}. That function is called with
558     *  {@code obj} as the argument; this allows to add the invalid value to
559     *  the exception detail message. The provided message supplier function
560     *  must accept {@code null} as a valid argument.</p>
561     *
562     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
563     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
564     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
565     *      in the event that a {@code ValidationException} is thrown. If
566     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
567     *      provided.
568     *  @param  validation  The validation
569     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
570     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The validation is {@code null}.
571     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
572     *
573     *  @since 0.1.0
574     */
575    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
576    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
577    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Function<? super T,String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
578    {
579        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
580        {
581            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
582                ? new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( obj ) )
583                : new NullArgumentException();
584            throw exception;
585        }
586
587        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
588        return obj;
589    }   //  require()
590
591    /**
592     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code obj} is {@code null} and
593     *  throws a
594     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
595     *  if it is {@code null}.}</p>
596     *
597     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
598     *  @param  obj The value to check.
599     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
600     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code obj} is {@code null}.
601     *
602     *  @see java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object)
603     */
604    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
605    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
606    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj ) throws NullArgumentException
607    {
608        if( isNull( obj ) ) throw new NullArgumentException();
609
610        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
611        return obj;
612    }   //  requireNonNull()
613
614    /**
615     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code obj} is {@code null} and
616     *  throws a
617     *  {@link ValidationException}
618     *  with the specified message if it is {@code null}.}</p>
619     *
620     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
621     *  @param  obj The value to check.
622     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
623     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
624     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
625     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code obj} is {@code null}.
626     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
627     *
628     *  @see java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object,String)
629     */
630    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
631    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj, final String message ) throws ValidationException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
632    {
633        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
634        if( isNull( obj ) ) throw new ValidationException( message );
635
636        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
637        return obj;
638    }   //  requireNonNull()
639
640    /**
641     *  <p>{@summary Checks that the specified object reference is not
642     *  {@code null} and throws a customized
643     *  {@link ValidationException}
644     *  if it is.}</p>
645     *  <p>Unlike the method
646     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object,String)},
647     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
648     *  null check failed. While this may confer a performance advantage in the
649     *  non-{@code null} case, when deciding to call this method care should be
650     *  taken that the costs of creating the message supplier are less than the
651     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
652     *
653     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
654     *  @param  obj The value to check.
655     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
656     *      in the event that a {@code NullArgumentException} is thrown. If
657     *      {@code null}, no detail message is provided.
658     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
659     *  @throws ValidationException    {@code obj} is {@code null}
660     */
661    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
662    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier) throws ValidationException
663    {
664        if( isNull( obj ) )
665        {
666            final var message = nonNull( messageSupplier ) ? messageSupplier.get() : null;
667            @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
668            final var exception = isNull( message ) ? new NullArgumentException() : new ValidationException( message );
669            throw exception;
670        }
671
672        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
673        return obj;
674    }   //  requireNonNull()
675
676    /**
677     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
678     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
679     *  if it is {@code null}.
680     *
681     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
682     *  @param  arg The argument to check.
683     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
684     *      message.
685     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
686     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
687     */
688    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
689    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name )
690    {
691        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
692        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
693        if( isNull( arg ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
694
695        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
696        return arg;
697    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
698
699    /**
700     *  <p>{@summary Checks if not both of the given arguments {@code arg} and
701     *  {@code otherArg} are {@code null} and throws a
702     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
703     *  if both are {@code null}.} Otherwise, it returns {@code arg}.</p>
704     *
705     *  @param  <T> The type of the first argument to check.
706     *  @param  arg The first argument to check; it will be returned in case of
707     *      success, even if {@code null}.
708     *  @param  otherArg    The other argument to check.
709     *  @param  name    The name of the first argument; this is used for the
710     *      error message.
711     *  @param  otherName   The name of the other argument; this is used for
712     *      the error message.
713     *  @return The first argument, even that might be {@code null}.
714     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Both arguments are {@code null}.
715     */
716    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
717    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final Object otherArg, final String name, final String otherName )
718    {
719        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
720        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
721        if( isNull( otherName ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "otherName" );
722        if( otherName.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "otherName" );
723        if( isNull( arg ) && isNull( otherArg ) )
724        {
725            throw new NullArgumentException( name, otherName );
726        }
727
728        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
729        return arg;
730    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
731
732    /**
733     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given String argument {@code arg} is
734     *  {@code null}, empty or blank and throws a
735     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
736     *  if it is {@code null}, an
737     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
738     *  if it is empty, or a
739     *  {@link BlankArgumentException}
740     *  if it is blank.}</p>
741     *
742     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
743     *  @param  arg The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
744     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
745     *      message.
746     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}, empty or blank.
747     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
748     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code arg} is empty.
749     *  @throws BlankArgumentException   {@code arg} is blank.
750     *
751     *  @see    String#isBlank()
752     */
753    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
754    public static final <T extends CharSequence> T requireNotBlankArgument( final T arg, final String name )
755    {
756        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
757        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
758
759        switch( arg )
760        {
761            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
762            //noinspection QuestionableName
763            case String string ->
764            {
765                if( string.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
766                if( string.isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
767            }
768            case CharSequence charSequence ->
769            {
770                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
771                if( charSequence.toString().isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
772            }
773        }
774
775        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
776        return arg;
777    }   //  requireNotBlankArgument()
778
779    /**
780     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code arg} is {@code null} or
781     *  empty and throws a
782     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
783     *  if it is {@code null}, or an
784     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
785     *  if it is empty.}</p>
786     *  <p>Strings, arrays, instances of
787     *  {@link java.util.Collection} and
788     *  {@link java.util.Map}
789     *  as well as instances of
790     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuilder},
791     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuffer},
792     *  and
793     *  {@link java.lang.CharSequence}
794     *  will be checked on being empty.</p>
795     *  <p>For an instance of
796     *  {@link java.util.Optional},
797     *  the presence of a value is checked in order to determine whether the
798     *  {@link Optional} is empty or not.</p>
799     *  <p>Because the interface
800     *  {@link java.util.Enumeration}
801     *  does not provide an API for the check on emptiness
802     *  ({@link java.util.Enumeration#hasMoreElements() hasMoreElements()}
803     *  will return {@code false} after all elements have been taken from
804     *  the {@code Enumeration} instance), the result for arguments of this
805     *  type has to be taken with caution.</p>
806     *  <p>For instances of
807     *  {@link java.util.stream.Stream},
808     *  this method will only check for {@code null} (like
809     *  {@link #requireNonNullArgument(Object,String)}.
810     *  This is because any operation on the stream itself would render it
811     *  unusable for later processing.</p>
812     *  <p>In case the argument is of type
813     *  {@link Optional},
814     *  this method behaves different from
815     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String)};
816     *  this one will return the {@code Optional} instance, while the other
817     *  method will return the contents of the {@code Optional}.</p>
818     *  <p>This method will not work properly for instances of
819     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner}, because its method
820     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner#length() length()}
821     *  will not return 0 when a prefix, suffix, or an
822     *  &quot;{@linkplain java.util.StringJoiner#setEmptyValue(CharSequence) empty value}&quot;
823     *  was provided.</p>
824     *
825     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
826     *  @param  arg The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
827     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
828     *      message.
829     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null} or empty.
830     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
831     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code arg} is empty.
832     */
833    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyComplexMethod" )
834    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
835    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( final T arg, final String name )
836    {
837        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
838        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
839
840        switch( arg )
841        {
842            /*
843             * When using guarding expressions, the code would not get better
844             * to read and to understand, as the positive cases will be handled
845             * all by the default case.
846             */
847            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
848            case CharSequence charSequence ->
849            {
850                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
851            }
852            case Collection<?> collection ->
853            {
854                if( collection.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
855            }
856            case Map<?,?> map ->
857            {
858                if( map.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
859            }
860            case Enumeration<?> enumeration ->
861            {
862                /*
863                 * The funny thing with an Enumeration is that it could have
864                 * been not empty in the beginning, but it may be empty
865                 * (= having no more elements) now.
866                 * The good thing is that Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will
867                 * not change the state of the Enumeration - at least it should
868                 * not do so.
869                 */
870                if( !enumeration.hasMoreElements() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
871            }
872            case Optional<?> optional ->
873            {
874                /*
875                 * This is different from the behaviour of
876                 * requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String) as the Optional
877                 * will be returned here.
878                 */
879                if( optional.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
880            }
881            default ->
882            {
883                if( arg.getClass().isArray() )
884                {
885                    if( Array.getLength( arg ) == 0 ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
886                }
887                else
888                {
889                    /*
890                     * Other data types are not further processed; in
891                     * particular, instances of Stream cannot be checked on
892                     * being empty. This is because any operation on the Stream
893                     * itself will change its state and may make the Stream
894                     * unusable.
895                     */
896                }
897            }
898        }
899
900        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
901        return arg;
902    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
903
904    /**
905     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code optional} of type
906     *  {@link Optional}
907     *  is {@code null} or
908     *  {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
909     *  and throws a
910     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
911     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
912     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
913     *  if it is empty.}</p>
914     *  <p>Otherwise it returns the value of the {@code Optional}.</p>
915     *  <p>This is different from the behaviour of
916     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Object,String)}
917     *  with an instance of {@code Optional} as the argument to test.</p>
918     *
919     *  @param  <T> The type of the given {@code Optional} to check.
920     *  @param  optional    The argument to check; can be {@code null}.
921     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
922     *      message.
923     *  @return The value of the argument if {@code optional} is not
924     *      {@code null}
925     *      and not
926     *      {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}. This could be the empty
927     *      string!
928     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code optional} is {@code null}.
929     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code optional} is empty.
930     */
931    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
932    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" ) final Optional<T> optional, final String name )
933    {
934        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
935        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
936
937        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
938        if( isNull( optional ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
939        final var retValue = optional.orElseThrow( () -> new EmptyArgumentException( name ) );
940
941        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
942        return retValue;
943    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
944
945    /**
946     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
947     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} second argument.}</p>
948     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
949     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object,Object) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse(Object,Object)}
950     *  as it will always check that the default is not {@code null}.</p>
951     *
952     *  @param <T>  The type of the references.
953     *  @param  obj An object reference.
954     *  @param  defaultObj  Another object reference to be returned if the
955     *      first argument is {@code null}.
956     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
957     *      second argument if it is not {@code null}.
958     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code defaultObj} is {@code null}.
959     *
960     *  @see    java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object, Object)
961     */
962    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
963    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElse( final T obj, final T defaultObj ) throws NullArgumentException
964    {
965        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse( obj, requireNonNullArgument( defaultObj, "defaultObj" ) );
966    }   //  requireNonNullElse()
967
968    /**
969     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
970     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} value returned by
971     *  {@link Supplier#get() supplier.get()}.}</p>
972     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
973     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier)}
974     *  as it will always check that the supplier is not {@code null}.</p>
975     *
976     *  @note   Although the provided {@code Supplier} may not be {@code null},
977     *      it may <i>return</i> {@code null}.
978     *
979     *  @param <T>  The type of the reference.
980     *  @param  obj An object reference.
981     *  @param  supplier    The supplier of a non-{@code null} object of type
982     *      {code T} to return if the first argument is {@code null}.
983     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
984     *      value returned by a call to {@code supplier.get()} if it is not
985     *      {@code null}.
986     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code supplier} is {@code null}.
987     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code obj} is {@code null} and the
988     *      return value of {@code supplier.get()} value is {@code null}, too.
989     */
990    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionDeclared" )
991    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
992    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElseGet( final T obj, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier ) throws NullArgumentException, NullPointerException
993    {
994        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet( obj, requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ) );
995    }   //  requireNonNullElseGet()
996
997    /**
998     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
999     *  {@link ValidationException}
1000     *  with a default message is thrown.
1001     *
1002     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1003     *  @param  arg The value to check; can be {@code null}.
1004     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1005     *      message.
1006     *  @param  validation  The validation
1007     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1008     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1009     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} or {@code validation} is
1010     *      {@code null}.
1011     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1012     *
1013     *  @since 0.1.0
1014     */
1015    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1016    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
1017    {
1018        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1019
1020        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
1021        {
1022            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
1023        }
1024
1025        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1026        return arg;
1027    }   //  requireValidArgument()
1028
1029    /**
1030     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
1031     *  that fails, a
1032     *  {@link ValidationException}
1033     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1034     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1035     *  argument.</p>
1036     *
1037     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1038     *  @param  arg The value to check; can be {@code null}.
1039     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1040     *      message.
1041     *  @param  validation  The validation
1042     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1043     *      exception.
1044     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1045     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1046     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name}, {@code validation} or
1047     *      {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1048     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1049     *
1050     *  @since 0.1.0
1051     */
1052    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1053    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
1054    {
1055        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1056        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
1057
1058        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
1059        {
1060            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
1061        }
1062
1063        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1064        return arg;
1065    }   //  requireValidArgument()
1066
1067    /**
1068     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
1069     *  {@link ValidationException}
1070     *  with a default message is thrown.
1071     *
1072     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1073     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1074     *      message.
1075     *  @param  validation  The validation
1076     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1077     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1078     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} or {@code validation} is
1079     *      {@code null}.
1080     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1081     *
1082     *  @since 0.2.0
1083     */
1084    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
1085    public static final double requireValidDoubleArgument( final double arg, final String name, final DoublePredicate validation )
1086    {
1087        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1088
1089        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
1090        {
1091            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
1092        }
1093
1094        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1095        return arg;
1096    }   //  requireValidDoubleArgument()
1097
1098    /**
1099     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
1100     *  that fails, a
1101     *  {@link ValidationException}
1102     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1103     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1104     *  argument.</p>
1105     *
1106     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1107     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1108     *      message.
1109     *  @param  validation  The validation
1110     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1111     *      exception.
1112     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1113     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1114     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name}, {@code validation} or
1115     *      {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1116     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1117     *
1118     *  @since 0.2.0
1119     */
1120    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
1121    public static final double requireValidDoubleArgument( final double arg, final String name, final DoublePredicate validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )

1124        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );

1129        }
1130

1271    /**
1272     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value (that must
1273     *  not be {@code null}), and if that fails, an
1274     *  {@link ValidationException}
1275     *  with a default message is thrown.}</p>
1276     *  <p>If the value is {@code null}, the validation is never triggered.</p>
1277     *
1278     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1279     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1280     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1281     *      message.
1282     *  @param  validation  The validation
1283     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1284     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
1285     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg}, {@code name} or
1286     *      {@code validation} is {@code null}.
1287     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1288     *
1289     *  @since 0.1.0
1290     */
1291    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1292    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
1293    {
1294        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1295
1296        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( arg, "name" ) ) )
1297        {
1298            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
1299        }
1300
1301        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1302        return arg;
1303    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1304
1305    /**
1306     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value (that must
1307     *  not be {@code null}), and if that fails, a
1308     *  {@link ValidationException}
1309     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1310     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1311     *  argument.</p>
1312     *
1313     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1314     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1315     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1316     *      message.
1317     *  @param  validation  The validation
1318     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1319     *      exception.
1320     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1321     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1322     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg}, {@code name},
1323     *      {@code validation} or {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1324     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1325     *
1326     *  @since 0.1.0
1327     */
1328    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1329    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
1330    {
1331        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1332        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
1333
1334        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( arg, "name" ) ) )
1335        {
1336            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
1337        }
1338
1339        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1340        return arg;
1341    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1342
1343    /**
1344     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1345     *  {@link String},
1346     *  usually by calling its
1347     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1348     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1349     *  &quot;{@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING null}&quot;
1350     *  will be returned instead. Arrays will be converted to a String through
1351     *  calling the respective {@code toString()} method from
1352     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1353     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1354     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object, String) java.util.Objects.toString()}).
1355     *  Values of type
1356     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1357     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1358     *  will be translated based on the default locale - whatever that is.
1359     *
1360     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1361     *  @return The object's string representation.
1362     *
1363     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1364     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1365     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1366     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1367     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1368     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1369     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1370     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1371     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1372     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1373     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1374     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING
1375     */
1376    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1377    public static final String toString( final Object object )
1378    {
1379        return toString( object, NULL_STRING );
1380    }   //  toString()
1381
1382    /**
1383     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1384     *  {@link String},
1385     *  usually by calling its
1386     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1387     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1388     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1389     *  instead.</p>
1390     *  <p>Arrays will be converted to a string through calling the respective
1391     *  {@code toString()} method from
1392     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1393     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1394     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object,String) java.util.Objects.toString(Object,String)}).</p>
1395     *  <p>Values of type
1396     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1397     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1398     *  will be translated based on the
1399     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}
1400     *  – whatever that is.</p>
1401     *
1402     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1403     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1404     *      is {@code null}.
1405     *  @return The object's string representation.
1406     *
1407     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1408     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1409     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1410     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1411     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1412     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1413     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1414     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1415     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1416     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1417     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1418     */
1419    @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks", "OverlyComplexMethod"} )
1420    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1421    public static final String toString( final Object object, final String nullDefault )
1422    {
1423        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1424        if( nonNull( object ) )
1425        {
1426            final var objectClass = object.getClass();
1427            if( objectClass.isArray() )
1428            {
1429                if( objectClass == byte [].class )
1430                {
1431                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (byte []) object );
1432                }
1433                else if( objectClass == short [].class )
1434                {
1435                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (short []) object );
1436                }
1437                else if( objectClass == int [].class )
1438                {
1439                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (int []) object );
1440                }
1441                else if( objectClass == long [].class )
1442                {
1443                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (long []) object );
1444                }
1445                else if( objectClass == char [].class )
1446                {
1447                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (char []) object );
1448                }
1449                else if( objectClass == float [].class )
1450                {
1451                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (float []) object );
1452                }
1453                else if( objectClass == double [].class )
1454                {
1455                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (double []) object );
1456                }
1457                else if( objectClass == boolean [].class )
1458                {
1459                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (boolean []) object );
1460                }
1461                else
1462                {
1463                    retValue = deepToString( (Object []) object );
1464                }
1465            }
1466            else
1467            {
1468                retValue = object.toString();
1469            }
1470        }
1471
1472        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1473        return retValue;
1474    }   //  toString()
1475
1476    /**
1477     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument into a
1478     *  {@link String}
1479     *  using the given instance of
1480     *  {@link Stringer}.}
1481     *  If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1482     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1483     *  instead.</p>
1484     *
1485     *  @param  <T> The type of the object.
1486     *  @param  value   The object; may be {@code null}.
1487     *  @param  stringer    The method that is used to convert the given object
1488     *      to a String.
1489     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1490     *      is {@code null}.
1491     *  @return The object's string representation.
1492     *
1493     *  @see    Stringer
1494     */
1495    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1496    public static final <T> String toString( final T value, final Stringer<? super T> stringer, final String nullDefault )
1497    {
1498        requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1499
1500        final var retValue = nonNull( value ) ? requireNonNullArgument( stringer, "stringer" ).toString( value ) : nullDefault;
1501
1502        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1503        return retValue;
1504    }   //  toString()
1505}
1506//  class Objects
